column4: it said the same thing when I clean installed 9.10, even though it has both 9.04 and XP on there, but it detected XP fine after I selected the partitions manually
can you please help me configure the partitions?
you said you already had 8.10 on there right? can't you just select the root and swap partitions from that? (and /home if you have it)
it should still be there though unless you deleted it...
yes, the partition is there. So, I right click on it, select change and use as what?
up to you, you may want to use ext4 (it is a bit quicker when it has to fsck)
assuming that was your old root partition from 8.10
ok, anything else I should change here? I keep the old swap and that's all?
and next screen I have to select username and pass. Will this be the root pass?
ubuntu doesn't use root passwords, that will be your main user, and you do everything you need to as root with sudo and your password
ok, it detected my xp user accounts. I guess it's going to work as dual boot
